channel.title: Tags on Coach Dench
channel.description: Recent content in Tags on Coach Dench

item.title: My Change to Dvorak
item.description: Practice Makes Permanent Like most people who started their education after 1982 - I started learning to type in elementary school, which was admittedly a long time ago. We learned with an early ‘edu-tainment game’ called PAWS on the school's Commodore 64s. For me, the most frustrating part came when we were done with a lesson. We were allowed to play games; but the teacher had to ‘review’ the lesson with you.

item.title: Asynchronous Code In JavaScript
item.description: What Is Asynchronous Code and When To Use It? For many developers the thought of “Asynchronous Code” conjures one of two equally haunting ghosts. One spirit capable of mysteriously unlocking untold amounts of performance by shipping tasks off to some fabled ‘background thread’. The other: a ghoul of odd behaviors and impossible-to-test synchronization problems. By the end of this article I hope to banish both of these ghosts, and replace them with a solid understanding of ‘async’ code, and how to use it in JavaScript.
